title.value: Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs: a microsimulation modelling approach
title.justification: The title is confirmed by the explicit mention at the start of the document and matches with the content discussed throughout the paper.
title.quote: Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs: a microsimulation modelling approach

extractions.description: This paper presents an economic evaluation and modeling study focused on needle and syringe programs (NSP) in terms of their clinical and cost-effectiveness on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs (PWID). Through microsimulation modeling, it compares scenarios with and without NSP to determine impacts on morbidity, mortality, and healthcare utilization.

type.justification: The paper involves the development and evaluation of a microsimulation model, leveraging real-world data and conducting empirical analysis on its effects.
type.quote: Methods We performed a model-based, economic evaluation comparing a scenario with NSP to a scenario without NSP.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the economic evaluation of health programs, particularly analyzing the cost-effectiveness of NSP in a health context.
name.quote: The objective of this study was to model the clinical- and cost-effectiveness of NSP with respect to treatment of SSTVI in PWID.

name.justification: Since the paper discusses health interventions and their broader impacts on public health outcomes, such as infections in PWID, it belongs to Public Health.
name.quote: Background Needle and syringe programs (NSP) are effective harm-reduction strategies...

name.justification: The study involves epidemiological analysis in understanding infection spread and impact among a specific population (PWID).
name.quote: Methods We performed a model-based... estimating quality-adjusted life-years (QALY) and cost (in 2022 Canadian dollars) over a 5-year time horizon.

name.justification: The model used in the study is explicitly described as a microsimulation model.
name.quote: We developed a microsimulation model to generate two cohorts of 100,000 individuals corresponding to each NSP scenario.

is_contributed.justification: The model is used in the research but not introduced or developed for the first time in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We developed a microsimulation model to generate two cohorts of 100,000 individuals corresponding to each NSP scenario.

is_executed.justification: The model was not executed on a hardware-specific basis such as GPU/CPU, as the paper involves theoretical modeling and simulations.
is_executed.quote: We developed a microsimulation model to generate two cohorts of 100,000 individuals corresponding to each NSP scenario.

is_compared.justification: The paper doesn't numerically compare the microsimulation model with other modeling approaches; it merely uses it for the study.
is_compared.quote: We developed a microsimulation model to generate two cohorts of 100,000 individuals corresponding to each NSP scenario.

referenced_paper_title.value: Modeling good research practices–overview: a report of the ISPOR-SMDM Modeling Good Research Practices Task Force–1
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the modeling framework guidelines referred to in setting up the research model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Modeling good research practices–overview: a report of the ISPOR-SMDM Modeling Good Research Practices Task Force–1
